sub_title: Initiator and Coordinator of Educational Programmes, Facilitator, Team Builder and  Mentor
summary:
I believe people can be empowered to discover new things about themselves every day and eventually realize their own strengths and potential to and by putting their great ideas into practice. 
I enjoy working with youth -and people with more experience in life- to facilitate processes by which they implement projects of impact in their school, organisation or communities. 
I entered the world of Education first as an international student but later, through Development and Human Rights, as a vehicle to support the change I believe our world needs. Still learning from wonderful people, of all ages, around me and trying to find new ways to bring about and support systemic change.
I cherish and need nature around me, from nurturing a seed to bloom into a beautiful flower  or a nutritious food, to contemplating trees moving in the forest. 
My interests are collaborative creation; physical, emotional and spiritual well-being and environmental sustainability.

school.name: The Mahindra United World College of India

courses.name: Coordinator of Leisure Activity Leaders and Facilitators

profile_positions.description:
Within this department  (re-branded in 2018) I have been:
- Youth Social Entrepreneurship Programme Coordinator (2015-present): launched and coordinated the YSE programme training all DP1 students every year (guest speakers, partnerships with local organisations, expert collaborators), including the coordination of a team of 15 facilitators/teaching staff and volunteers, delivering for almost 200 students, always facilitating space and opportunities for co-creation
- Designed curriculum in Social Entrepreneurship and Service Learning/Service as Action (Active Global Citizenship programme for MYP5 students and Sustainability programme for MYP4 students) and facilitated training in the above for 13-16 year old students
- Mentored student initiated projects and ongoing initiatives (such as the Environmental Action Group)
- Re-launched by re-structuring and coordinated the Eco-School Committee (Eco-Team) at our school (since 2018)
- Produced the report for our second Green Flag (Eco-Schools) in 2019-2020
- Supervised international culture weeks led by students
- Managed funding for projects (selection, allocation, follow up, reporting) 
- Coordinated the organisation of UWC Day (since 2017), involving up to 1000 people
- Represented UWC Maastricht in the Dutch network as an Ashoka Changemaker School (since 2016 to 2019)
- As a CAS Advisor (2018-2020) I have supported students in their Creativity, Activity and Service experiences throughout the completion of their IB Diploma
- Any other projects/events involving engagement with the local communities
profile_positions.title: Programmes Coordinator (Youth Social Entrepreneurship and Eco-School) - Community Engagement

profile_positions.description:
- Mentoring of 24 boys in residential living on campus and duty/on call tasks for 200 students every 2 months
- First Aid and Fire Prevention trained staff member
- Working towards maintaining a culture of harmony and trust among students in this residential setting
profile_positions.title: Residence Mentor

profile_positions.description:
- Research and data collection/tracking of graduates from our school (transition from paper to digital data) since opening in 2009
- Coordination of communication with former students, especially via social media
- Introduction, integration and coordination of new Alumni Relations platform software installed in 2016
- Attendance to professional development conferences
- Co-creation, coordination and management of several social media channels representing the school
profile_positions.title: Alumni Relations Officer & Social Media Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
University application processing, writing of testimonials and recommendation letters, in-take interviews, counseling on UK and Spanish universities selection and application process, coordination of universities/university fairs visiting school.
Coordination of workshop for final year (DP2) students leaving the school after graduation (2015-2018)
profile_positions.title: University Counselor

profile_positions.description:
•	Co-designing of the Summer Programme Action x Change 2012
•	Logistical organisation of the programme
•	Communication with candidates, parents, students, guest speakers, collaborators and providers
•	Overall coordination during the summer programme and blog development
•	Mentoring of some students’ projects
•	Production of evaluation reports for sponsors and potential partners
profile_positions.title: Programmes Coordinator

profile_positions.location: Madrid Area, Spain and MENA region
profile_positions.description:
•	Production of strategy recommendations and evaluation reports for the Spanish national committee.
•	Communications with MENA national committees, MENA Initiative Director and Coordinator, the UWC International Office and collaborators.
•	Monitoring of performance and evaluation reports from those national committees which received Spanish funds.
•	Attendance of MENA Initiative strategy meetings in Madrid, Belgium, Egypt and London; selection processes in Morocco and Jordan and MENA Regional Meeting in Jordan as a representative of the Spanish national committee.
•	Co-designing and logistical organisation of the Training of Trainers three day workshop for MENA national committee members in Comillas, Spain (2011).
•	Contribution to capacity building of national committees in the MENA region.
profile_positions.title: MENA Promotion Committee Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	UWC España College Project’s assistant: production of materials for sponsors, Council of Patrons and the Task Force; attendance of meetings and delivering of presentations with/for partners, sponsors, the community, educational institutions and UWC constituents, including the Task Force
•	Research, data collection and benchmarking on many aspects of the project.
•	Design of the academic, pastoral and extra-curricular areas of the project. Also, IB 
        Coordinator for the IB application process.
•	Management of Alumni Relations for the UWC Spanish Committee Foundation (significant 
        update/creation of data base in 2009).
•	Support to the work undertaken by other colleagues/departments.

In addition, Alumni Relations person for the Foundation.
profile_positions.title: Director General's Assistant for the UWC ESPAÑA College Project
